rows.title: Review and Objectives
rows.intro_text:
Your practice for this week was to:
@data.set_hp.{@row.id}.text
rows.question_done: Did you get a chance to practice the previous activity?
rows.feedback_no: That is okay, do not be too hard on yourself. We encourage you to try and do it when you can.
rows.feedback_happy: Great to hear it went well. You are a star!
rows.feedback_okay: Every small step counts. Keep up the good work!
rows.feedback_sad: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!
rows.outro_text: Encouragement to continue doing the home practice.

rows.question_done: Were you able to invite your partner/ other family members to reflect with you on the importance of close family relationships?
Did you have any time to practice any activities that help you achieve the child you desire?
rows.feedback_no: You can always find this  activity in our session on @data.topic.{@row.id}.title
rows.feedback_happy: Good job on getting you and your family to talk about parenting family goals and objectives.
rows.outro_text: To achieve your dream child in 20 years, there is need for every parent to be deliberate in their parenting and to invest time and care from the start.

rows.question_done: Were you able to have an interactive play with your child while following their lead in the game they chose?
Did you get a chance to practice one play or fun moment from your childhood that improves your relationship with your children?
rows.feedback_no: Regularly taking initiative to do a positive practice to your child will help build a positive relationship with him/her. You can always refer back to this practise activity in our session 4 on Attachment and Bonding - Influence of one’s own parents and positive discipline techniques
rows.feedback_happy: Good job on integrating a positive practice from your childhood to improve the relationship with your child. We have a deep and long-lasting impact on our children’s lives. These legacies may be positive or negative and are passed on intentionally or unintentionally.
rows.outro_text: Continue practicing positive things from your childhood with your child. This will strengthen the relationship you have with your child.

rows.question_done: Were you able to practice the new techniques of resolving conflict?
rows.question_other: What were the benefits and challenges about the promise of having a non- violent home?

rows.question_done: Did you get time to discuss with your partner/children about the benefits of family time and ways family members can support one another?
rows.feedback_happy: Good job on getting you and your family to talk about benefits and challenges of spending family time and the domestic chores or childcare activity you did with them.
rows.outro_text: You can always find this home practise activity in our session 8 on Sharing Child Care Responsibility

rows.question_done: Did you get time to do something interesting with your adolescent childlren during the week and hold the feedback session.
rows.feedback_no: Regularly taking initiative to do a positive practice to your child will help build a positive relationship with him/her. You can always refer back to this home practise activity in our session 11

rows.question_done: Have you managed to practice positive ways to discipline the children?
rows.question_how: How is this improving your child’s discipline?
rows.feedback_happy: Good job! Disciplining your child in positive ways will encourage good behavior and discourage bad behaviors hence promoting respect.
rows.outro_text: Achieving good behavior takes practicing positive ways to discipline your child. You can always find this home practice activity in our session on Achieving Respectability and Discipline

rows.question_done: Were you able to discuss the effects of the gender norms and practices that influenced your adult behaviour and parenting styles today with your children and spouse; and together decide on what you should change?

rows.question_other: What benefits and challenges of gender norms did you reflect on and what plans have you come up with to modify some of these on families?
